result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10.12.2022
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Chauncey J Morgan.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of William R. F. Ackell for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the stay of the Bench Warrant.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan not in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Chauncey J Morgan.  Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for a plea hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court authorized ADA to appear by zoom on the next scheduled court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Calendar call scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
JusticePoint Status Report, filed.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense received offer and requested plea hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer C. Boyack. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.

*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 31, 2022 - received

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Order to show cause hearing.  Attorney William Rakestraw was appointed as counsel of record.  The matter is scheduled for preliminary hearing in prelim court.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-9-2022, Filed.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee Hearing in Branch 28.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered and oral no contact order with SPD.  State to submit a written no contact order.
Defense is requesting a bail review.

Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Chauncey J Morgan in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
